alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 10 at 9:41AM PST until March 10 at 12:45PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Francisco has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Santa Cruz County in northern California... * Until 1245 PM PST. * At 941 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall around a half inch to one is expected in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. High water will continue to move downstream on the San Lorezno River. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Santa Cruz and Felton. This includes the following streams and drainages... Carbonera Creek, San Lorenzo River and Gold Gulch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
